body:
Hello @anna-teruel, you could edit `project_path` in the config.yaml file manually and things should work fine afterwards. From the image path I can tell that you're on windows, whereas the project path points to a Unix machine. This manual operation is typically not required (unless something wrong happens when parsing the config) as DeepLabCut automatically updates that field to match the current OS/project folder location.
As a side note, "creating a training dataset on a different computer where the training will be performed was obviously a mistake" isn't true anymore, as paths to data or images are now independent of your work station OS. I hope that helps! ☺️

I am sorry to reopen this issue. But haven't solved the problem yet. It seems to happen when I try to load old projects into new versions of deeplabcut. In the end my colleague created a new project and started once again. He didn't try to change paths in the config file. However, now a different colleague has the same issue, and I think that, perhaps, has something to do with old and new versions. She took an old training and used it to analyze new videos from the same paradigm. She extracted outliers and refined them. When we save refined frames it seems that it is being saved, as shown in the picture: However, in our console we get following warning/error: `2022-02-22 09:42:04.084 python[637:5981] Warning: Expected min height of view: () to be less than or equal to 30 but got a height of 32.000000. This error will be logged once per view in violation. 2022-02-22 09:42:17.466 python[637:5981] Warning: Expected min height of view: () to be less than or equal to 30 but got a height of 32.000000. This error will be logged once per view in violation. Checking labels if they are outside the image 2022-02-22 09:43:19.041 python[637:5981] Warning: Expected min height of view: () to be less than or equal to 30 but got a height of 32.000000. This error will be logged once per view in violation. 2022-02-22 09:43:19.042 python[637:5981] Warning: Expected min height of view: () to be less than or equal to 30 but got a height of 32.000000. This error will be logged once per view in violation. 2022-02-22 09:43:33.591 python[637:5981] Warning: Expected min height of view: () to be less than or equal to 30 but got a height of 32.000000. This error will be logged once per view in violation.` I have checked CollectedData files created when frames are refined and seems to be wrong. Somewhy it divides the path into three columns: I thought I could manually edit it, however I think (I might be wrong) that training dataset is created from the .h5 file, which I don't know how to edit. After merging dataset everything seems to be fine: `Merged data sets and updated refinement iteration to 4. Now you can create a new training set for the expanded annotated images (use create_training_dataset).` I have tried, after that, to check my labels, but it doesn't seem to work. Not even with old folders from my project. `2022-02-22 09:52:57.740 python[637:5981] Warning: Expected min height of view: () to be less than or equal to 30 but got a height of 32.000000. This error will be logged once per view in violation. Creating images with labels by Camila. Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/gui/label_frames.py", line 192, in check_labelF check_labels(self.config, visualizeindividuals=False) File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 310, in check_labels color_by=color_by, File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/visualization.py", line 307, in make_labeled_images_from_dataframe h, w = ic[0].shape[:2] File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/skimage/io/collection.py", line 294, in __getitem__ self.data[idx] = self.load_func(self.files[n], **kwargs) File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/skimage/io/_plugins/imageio_plugin.py", line 10, in imread return np.asarray(imageio_imread(*args, **kwargs)) File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/imageio/core/functions.py", line 159, in imread with imopen(uri, "ri", plugin=format) as file: File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/imageio/core/imopen.py", line 223, in imopen raise err_type(err_msg) ValueError: ImageIO does not generally support reading folders. Limited support may be available via specific plugins. Specify the plugin explicitly using the `plugin` kwarg, e.g. `plugin='DICOM'`` Finally, when I try to create training dataset, get the following error: `Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/gui/create_training_dataset.py", line 345, in create_training_dataset augmenter_type=self.aug_choice.GetValue(), File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 866, in create_training_dataset Data, trainIndices, nbodyparts, project_path File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 631, in format_training_data img_shape = read_image_shape_fast(os.path.join(project_path, *filename)) File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 613, in read_image_shape_fast with Image.open(path) as img: File "/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT_M1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 2953, in open fp = builtins.open(filename, "rb") IsADirectoryError: [Errno 21] Is a directory: '/Users/annateruel/LPS-Camila-2021-12-27/labeled-data' ` If I check my training dataset folder iterartion-4 there's a CollectedData file created. However, the path seems to be missing: I think that is happening because refined labels are not correctly saved, somehow. I don't know how to fix this, but I am willing to do so because we don't want to lose all labeled frames and start once again. Any help or tip is welcome and appreciated. THANK YOU

No worries, you are not going to lose your annotated data 🙂
Indeed, the paths are now stored without path separators (in 3 separate columns), so the file you show is written properly (you're right though, it's ultimately the h5 file rather than the csv that matters). Old data format should automatically be converted to the newer MultiIndex with deeplabcut 2.2.0.6, but I'll check whether I can reproduce your error!

Thank you very much @jeylau !
If you need me to incorporate more data or information, let me know.

Hey @anna-teruel , I tried to reproduce your error using the [example project](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/tree/master/examples/openfield-Pranav-2018-10-30), which was created in an older deeplabcut version, therefore using the same label naming convention as your older projects. 

I trained a network using the existing labeled data, analyzed a video, extracted outlier frames, refined labels, and merged the data. Then I checked the labels and created a training dataset. Everything worked as expected, so either:
1. I did not follow your steps to reproduce the error correctly
2. The issue could be project specific in which case we could provide you with a small data conversion code snippet so that all your data are written correctly in the .h5 (and .csv) files

Hi @intergalactic-mammoth , thanks a lot for trying to reproduce my error. Perhaps it would be more clear for you if you directly see our project folder. Is there a way I could send you our project folder from here? 

If you think it is easier, I can try with that small data conversion code snippet and see If we can save our labeled frames. 

Again, thanks for your help!

hi @anna-teruel - I noticed when you import deeplabcut you have an issue with PyTables, which is important for creating H5 files. Maybe also try reinstalled DeepLabCut... 

```python
/opt/sci-soft/software/DeepLabCut/2.2.0.6-Anaconda3-GPU/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py:717: FutureWarning: `windows2l$
  warnings.warn(
/opt/sci-soft/software/DeepLabCut/2.2.0.6-Anaconda3-GPU/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pandas/io/pytables.py:314: PerformanceWarning:
your performance may suffer as PyTables will pickle object types that it cannot
map directly to c-types [inferred_type->mixed,key->axis1] [items->None]

  f(store)
DLC loaded in light mode; you cannot use any GUI (labeling, relabeling and standalone GUI)
```

> Perhaps it would be more clear for you if you directly see our project folder. Is there a way I could send you our project folder from here?

Hello @anna-teruel! You can also send us a Google Drive/ DropBox / link to your project and we can try to look into it

issue.title: Fix TypeError when refining outliers

labels.name: bug fix!
labels.description: fix for a real buggy one...

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Machine labels are now guaranteed to have hierarchical indices, avoiding mixed-format indices when concatenated with GT annotations. 

Fixes #1743 #1673

body: @anna-teruel, the error has been fixed with #1763 and will be live in DeepLabCut 2.2.1 😃

issue.title: Trouble refining outliers from previous DLC release projects

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Hi, 
I am currently using DLC networks I created a year ago (probably with DLC 2.1.1) to analyze some videos I already analyzed, refined merge to training dataset before. Scorer name and all the folder path are still the same, I only recently updated DLC to 2.2.1. 

As usual, after the video analysis step, I extracted some outlier frames and tried to correct them, however when I click on "save" after refining a video, I get the following errors: `TypeError: '<' not supported between instances of 'str' and 'tuple'`then `ValueError: On level 0, code max (3) >= length of level (1). NOTE: this index is in an inconsistent state`. 

Also, relaunching the refinement GUI and trying to correct the label a second time makes DLC crashes.

I currently have the same issue on 2 other networks I created at the same period and I'm unable to create new training dataset similar to this issue https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1673, however, updating DLC to the 2.2.1 didn't fix it for me.

If you could help me understand what's going on, that would be great ! 
Thanks 

### Operating System

ubuntu 20.04

### DeepLabCut version

DLC 2.2.1

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu 

### Steps To Reproduce

load a network created with an old DLC version (?)
Analyze an old set of videos that was previously analyzed and refined 
Successfully Extract Outlier Frames
Launch the Outlier Labeling GUI using LAUNCH GUI
Select the machinelabels-iter0.h5 file in the appropriate labeled-data folder 
Correct labels
save

### Relevant log output
